summary: I am a purpose-driven machine learning enthusiast aiming to innovate the world. I get energy from working with inspiring people to better the world. I enjoy thinking about new and creative approaches, but I am also not afraid to be critical to make sure that the right steps are taken and to deliver quality work. In this sense, feedback is key and I look forward to improving together.

education.degree_name: High School Degree, FCE, CAE, and CPE

awards.title: National Champion Competitive Debating 2023
awards.description:
On March 18, 2023, me and my team partner became national champions in competitive debating. We won the finals about a topic close to my heart: sustainability and the future of our planet. Should we dam the North Sea to protect against rising sea levels? This a crucial discussion to have about a major problem for many European countries.

In the preliminary rounds, the topics that were discussed included whether we should pay more child support to stay-at-home parents compared to increasing subsidies for daycares, as well as whether the Netherlands should provide far-reaching military support to Ukraine.

https://www.debatbond.nl/en/debating/dutch-debating-championships/

awards.title: Teun Sluijters Award: Best Debater in National Championship Finals
awards.description: During the National Debating Championships, I won the inaugural Teun Sluijters award for the best speech in the finals. The issuers commended how I mixed the substantiation of my arguments with a sharp sense of humour. I am extremely honoured to have won this award.

awards.title: 3rd Place Milgard Case Competition on Social Responsibility
awards.description:
The Milgard Case Competition on Social Responsibility (https://www.tacoma.uw.edu/milgard/clsr/miccsr) of 2020 was about a (fictitious) socially responsible investment fund wondering whether or not to invest in Saudi Aramco. We applied a PEST analysis using ESG scores, geopolitical circumstances, and financial analysis (the Multiples and Discounted Cash Flow methods) to find this out. 

With my fellow teammates Vera van Koetsveld, Alec Jadon, and María Fernanda Sánchez Valbuena, we managed to beat 4 other universities in the preliminary rounds to reach the finals. There, we came in 3rd place.
awards.issuer: Milgard School Of Business (University of Washington | Tacoma)

awards.title: Top 10 competitive debater in the Netherlands
awards.description: From December 2019 up to March 2019, I have been in the top 10 debaters of the Netherlands, taking the 3rd, 6th, and 9th position.

awards.title: Champion Cicero Internal Debate Tournament 2018 (Tilburg, NL)
awards.description: After 3 preliminary rounds, my teampartner and I beat an opposing strong team in the finals and won the internal tournament of TDV Cicero in 2018.

awards.title: Novice Finalist Roosevelt Open Debate Tournament 2014 (Middelburg, NL)
awards.description: At my very first debating tournament, after 5 preliminary rounds, my teampartner and I managed to reach the novice finals (where only new debaters can participate in). Unfortunately, we did not manage to win.

awards.title: Selection of achievements in competitive debating
awards.description:
Below, you will find a selection of my achievements in competitive debating.

As a debater:
- Top 10 debater of the Netherlands (December 2018 until March 2019)
- 20th best English as Second Language team at the European Universities Debating Championships (EUDC) 2018.
- Reached the final rounds of 10 debating tournaments, among which the Roosevelt Open Debate Tournament 2017 (Middelburg) and the Bonapartian Debate Tournament 2019 (Amsterdam).
- Champion Cicero Internal Debate Tournament 2018

As a judge:
- Selected to be the chair judge for 7 out of 9 rounds at the European Universities Debating Championships (EUDC) 2017. I was also selected to judge the Semifinals in the English as a Second Language category.
- Judged final rounds at 19 debating tournaments.
- Selected to be a chief adjudicator (CA) at 11 tournaments. Chief Adjudicators come up with the subjects of the debates. They do this by thinking of and analysing debate motions critically to see what kind of arguments can be made on either side and whether the motion is fair. This requires a creative mind and a critical eye for detail. I served as CA, for example, at the Dutch National Championships of 2018.

projects.title: Cicero Debating Tournament 2015 - Organizing Committee
projects.description:
The video provided as project URL was made by Jesse Huiskamp. 

The Cicero Tournament is an annually recurring debating tournament, and is the largest in the southern part of the Netherlands. Debaters from all around the Netherlands gather at this tournament to test their debating skills against each other.

I helped to organise the tournament on behalf of T.D.V. Cicero. Example of the work I did there was tabbing (collecting and processing match results), producing introductory videos to motions, making lunch, and more. The Cicero Tournament 2015 is one of the biggest in its kind in the Netherlands and kicks off the Dutch debating season every academic year.

projects.title: Chief Adjudicator at 10+ debating tournaments
projects.description:
Chief Adjudicators (CA) come up with the subjects of the debates. They do this by thinking of and analysing debate motions critically to see what kind of arguments can be made on either side and whether the motion is fair. This requires a creative mind and a critical eye for detail.

I served as CA, for example, at the Dutch National Championships of 2018.

projects.title: Cicero Debating Tournament 2017 - Co-chairperson
projects.description:
The Cicero (Debating) Tournament is an annually recurring debating tournament, and is the largest in the southern part of the Netherlands. Debaters from all around the Netherlands gather at this tournament to test their debating skills against each other. The Cicero Tournament is one of the biggest in its kind in the Netherlands and kicks off the Dutch debating season every academic year.

I helped to organise the tournament on behalf of T.D.V. Cicero as one of its chairpersons (also known as 'convenor').

contributors.headline: Wetgevingsjurist bij het Ministerie van Onderwijs, Cultuur en Wetenschap

projects.title: "Hear, Hear!" - T.D.V. Cicero's Association Magazine
projects.description: The "Hear, Hear" is the magazine of the Tilburg Debating Society Cicero. Around 5 editions are released each academic year. As a member of this committee, I have written articles on a wide array of subjects, such as political ideas, tips and tricks in competitive debating, and so on. Moreover, I functioned as a proofreader for the magazine and also did the design.

contributors.headline: Wetgevingsjurist bij het Ministerie van Onderwijs, Cultuur en Wetenschap

projects.title: Nekst committee - Asset | Econometrics's Association Magazine
projects.description:
Nekst is the quarterly magazine of the study association Asset | Econometrics. Nekst reports of activities organized by Asset | Econometrics, publishes interviews with interesting econometricians and informs on current affairs at Tilburg University, the study association and the study Econometrics and Operations Research. Besides this, there is space for (semi-)scientific articles.

As editor in the Nekst committee of Asset | Econometrics, I have written several articles. These articles have been about interviews I had with people in the field of Econometrics and Operations Research, such as professors and employees of some big companies employing econometricians, for example KPN and APG. I also wrote about other subjects regarding mathematics and econometrics, for example the relation between mathematics and crime.

projects.title: Book of Faces - Chairperson
projects.description:
The Book of Faces committee makes sure that all Asset | Econometrics members can find each other without any problems. They create the Book of Faces, in which you can find addresses and telephone numbers of all members and teachers. The Book of Faces is sent to the students and teachers by the end of September. 

As chairperson of this committee, I had to make sure that the meetings went smoothly, as well as keeping everything in order. This year specifically, we needed to construct a new layout for the booklet, due to not including certain contact information anymore. In this layout a clear distinction needed to be made between students with a different starting year of their studies in econometrics. This year's Book of Faces had the theme "Sports", where every year shall be represented by a well known sport and esteemed athletes.

projects.title: Promotion Committee 2014-2015
projects.description: The Promotion Committee of T.D.V. Cicero is responsible for promotion of the association, as the name implies. I contributed to the committee by, amongst others, editing videos and making visual art for the YouTube page of T.D.V. Cicero.

projects.title: Cicero Debating Tournament 2014 - Organizing Committee
projects.description:
The video provided as project URL was made by Jesse Huiskamp. 

The Cicero Tournament is an annually recurring debating tournament, and is the largest in the southern part of the Netherlands. Debaters from all around the Netherlands gather at this tournament to test their debating skills against each other.

As a member of the Tournament Committee in 2014, I took care of making introductory videos to the motions, was a junior tabmaster (the person who processes all results and forms a new schedule for each round), and made sure that the tournament was running smoothly overall. The Cicero Tournament 2014 is one of the biggest in its kind in the Netherlands and kicks off the Dutch debating season every academic year.

profile_positions.description:
Operationalizing Machine Learning models for detecting financial crime. We maintain a state-of-the-art platform to optimize the development and production process of these models. This includes monitoring of data and models. Please see the attached video for an inspiring talk by my colleagues.

In addition, I am involved in implementing data and model governance through implementing Microsoft Purview in our automated CI/CD pipelines.

I joined the Nudge Global Impact Challenge 2022-2023, a leadership program focussing on sustainability. Together with my colleague Mohamed Mobarak, we delved deeper into the topic of Sustainable IT (SIT) and worked to improve this within ABN AMRO Bank by developing SIT Tactics to be applied by other teams.

I am active for the ABN AMRO Foundation, allowing me to use working days for volunteering work. For instance, I helped to clean up the beach and tutored a primary school student in mathematics.
profile_positions.title: Machine Learning Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Data engineering with a focus on automating rule-based detection of financial crime. Integrity and completeness of the results are ensured by applying well-established software testing and development methods with cutting-edge technology, such as Microsoft Azure, PySpark, and CI/CD pipelines.

Besides my job, I am active for the ABN AMRO Foundation, allowing me to use working days for volunteering work. For instance, I helped to clean up the beach and tutored a primary school student in mathematics.
profile_positions.title: Data Engineer (Business Rules Automation)

profile_positions.description:
Within the 2-year data programme in Detecting Financial Crime, I rotate through different teams while following an extensive development programme with hard skill courses (data engineering, data science, Azure), soft skill courses (collaboration, persuasion, handling feedback), and regular coaching sessions.

Besides my job, I am active for the ABN AMRO Foundation, allowing me to use working days for volunteering work. For instance, I helped to clean up the beach and tutored a primary school student in mathematics.

- Rotation 1: Building and maintaining Power BI dashboards and reports
- Rotation 2: Overseeing and maintaining the workflow of cases within the department with a Django app built in Python
- Rotation 3: MLOps Engineering, including unit tests, CI/CD model pipelines, code refactoring, MLflow, data drift detection
- Rotation 4: Thematic investigations with SQL and Python to assess Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing risks
profile_positions.title: Detecting Financial Crime Data Traineeship

profile_positions.description:
The Nederlandse Debatbond (Dutch Debating Union) is the umbrella organisation for Dutch debating. It supports boards of individual societies as well as furthering the sport of debating in the Netherlands. As secretary, I was responsible for internal communication, such as drafting newsletters and being editor-in-chief to the online blog SevenTwenty, and the Dutch Debating League (see attached videos). I was also jointly responsible for acquiring sponsorships and organizing debating tournaments.

My main goals as a board member of the Nederlandse Debatbond were to provide valuable support to our member boards, improve social cohesion among Dutch debaters, and to increase the number of debaters in the Netherlands.

For the Dutch Debating League, I was in charge of the organizational side of setting up a new style for the competition. I was also a co-host of the live-streamed debates, where I was in charge of the technical side.
profile_positions.title: Secretary of the Board

profile_positions.description: As a mathematics tutor, I gave exam coaching to PABO students (those studying to become teachers). This taught me how to convey knowledge to other people efficiently on a subject that I enjoy thinking about. Tutoring also requires flexibility regarding your explanations, since a different teaching method may be required if another does not work.
profile_positions.title: Mathematics Exam Coach

company.name: Koninklijke Bibliotheek (KB), nationale bibliotheek van Nederland

profile_positions.company: Koninklijke Bibliotheek (KB), nationale bibliotheek van Nederland
profile_positions.description:
The National Library of the Netherlands processes historical documents by Optical Character Recognition. Currently, the only measure of quality available are the ones provided by ABBYY FineReader, the software that is used to perform OCR. For my Master Thesis, I started to research how best to measure the quality of digitised text in the absence of ground truth data.

Unfortunately, the project did not fully align with my Master in Econometrics so it had to be terminated.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Internship: Measuring the quality of texts digitized by Optical Character Recognition

profile_positions.company: UbiOps - powerful AI model serving & orchestration
profile_positions.description: As a Data Consultant/Engineer at Dutch Analytics, I worked on data science, management, and processing in order to facilitate building state-of-the-art data science models to predict when maintenance is necessary for clients. For this, I used various applications of Python and PostgreSQL, as well as building dashboards in Tableau to communicate findings to clients.
profile_positions.title: Data Consultant/Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Bijlesnetwerk facilitates personal tutoring, homework supervising and exam coaching, both at home and at school, all over the Netherlands.

As a mathematics tutor, I have given one-on-one extra classes and exam coaching. This taught me how to convey knowledge to other people efficiently on a subject that I enjoy thinking about. Tutoring also requires flexibility regarding your explanations, since a different teaching method may be required if another does not work.
profile_positions.title: Mathematics Tutor and Exam Coach

profile_positions.description:
Tilburg University is a public research university specialising in the social and behavioural sciences, economics, law, business sciences, theology and humanities, located in Tilburg in the southern part of the Netherlands. Tilburg University has been specifically renowned for its Economics faculty, currently ranking 10th in Europe.

Tilburg University's marketing department is aiming to reach out in a more informal and accessible way by making use of vlogs. Two students, one of which being myself, have been selected to publish vlogs relating to the events of Tilburg University. For example, we have made a vlog regarding the opening of the Jheronimus Academy of Data Science (JADS), which is a partnership of the Province of North Brabant, 's-Hertogenbosch, Eindhoven University of Technology and Tilburg University. There, we made make sure that viewers of the vlog will gain the right first impressions by interviewing one of the students.
profile_positions.title: Vlogger

profile_positions.description:
The Dutch Debating Winter School, or DDWS for short, is an intensive training week in Tilburg where world-class trainers taught a variety of participants all about competitive debating and public speaking. The workshops took place over the course of three days. The week was closed with a two-day British Parliamentary-style tournament to apply all skills acquired through the workshops. Participants from over 20 nationalities joined the first edition of the DDWS.

As co-coordinator, I was partially responsible for setting up this new concept to the fullest. We made sure that there was cheap accommodation and catering available and that world-class trainers would be attending. My focus was more on taking care of the financial means by finding sponsors and partners for the project. Under this, I moreover set up a budget and realisation.
profile_positions.title: Co-coordinator Dutch Debating Winter School

profile_positions.description:
T.D.V. Cicero is a vivid debating society, settled in Tilburg. With an expanding amount of members, it is a society that is sure to provide anyone with the soft skills that they want to learn, or just plainly the immense joy that debating can bring.

As vice chairperson, I was mostly responsible for leading the (newly set up) international branch of T.D.V. Cicero and I functioned as its chairperson. However, I also served as vice chairperson for the entire society. As such, I covered the chairperson's tasks when they were not present. As a board, we managed to achieve the highest amount of members that Cicero ever had, exceeding 100 members.

Secondly, I provided workshops to external parties and to our members. Moreover, I joined the "Hear, Hear!" committee, which produces five digital magazines per academic year, as a proofreader. Lastly, I was the supervisor for the tournament committee of 2015 and regulated our delegations for debating tournaments, together with the secretary.
profile_positions.title: Vice Chairperson of the Board

profile_positions.description: As shop employee at Lidl, I have been responsible for filling the shelves, tending the counter and keeping the store tidy.
profile_positions.title: Shop employee

profile_positions.description: As shop employee at Aldi, I have been responsible for filling the shelves, tending the counter and keeping the store tidy.
profile_positions.title: Shop employee

volunteer_experiences.description: As an advisory board member to the board of the Tilburg Debating Society Cicero of 2017-2018, I advised the board on, amongst others, their policy.

As an active member of the Tilburg Debating Society Cicero, I have partaken in various events and organised many as well. I attended weekly meetings, where members of T.D.V. Cicero debated each other on a wide array of topics (politics, economics, ethics, etcetera) in various debate formats. Moreover, I have attended over 30 debate tournaments across Europe, among which the European Championships and the World Championships. As the highlight of this, I managed to finish as one-half of the 20th best English as a Second Language team out of 194 at the European Championships 2018 in Novi Sad, Serbia.

Asset | Econometrics is the study association for students in Econometrics and Operations Research at Tilburg University. More information on what I did within Asset | Econometrics can be found under 'Projects'. As an example, I was the chairperson for the 'Book of Faces' committee and I was a regular active member of the 'Nekst' (the association magazine) committee.

As an active member of the Leiden Debating Union, I have partaken in various events. I have attended weekly meetings, where members of the LDU debated each other on a wide array of topics (politics, economics, ethics, etcetera).
As an advisory board member to the board of the Tilburg Debating Society Cicero of 2019-2020, I advised the board on, amongst others, their policy.

As the Training and Development Officer for the Tilburg Debating Society Cicero, I provided fortnightly workshops to its members on the ins and outs of competitive debating. On top of that, I arranged for external trainers, such as those from other debating societies, to come to Tilburg and give workshops as well.
